page.title: 11S/N - Information Centres
page.content: A Lincolnshire County Council travelling library visits Northorpe and Scotton once a fortnight, on a Thursday morning, making one stop of about half an hour in each village. It carries a good selection of books for adults and children, both fiction and non-fiction; the two librarians are helpful and books not on the van may be ordered; up to six books may be borrowed at a time. The village shop provides an unofficial "information centre" here as in many other villages (as does the pub in Scotton); news and gossip are exchanged and adverts and notices are displayed. Scotton also has a Parish Council notice board and a Village Hall notice board. Daily morning and evening papers are deliver -ed from the shop, youngsters working as delivery boys. (Sunday papers are brought in by an outside agent).
